utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: What are you –

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Your throat feel any better?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Why’d I have to get mono?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it’s called the kissing disease for a reason. I assume you and Max were – I’m going to stop right there.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I think that’s best.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Make you some tea. Sorry about this. I know this isn’t what you expected when you asked to stay here while your place is being fumigated. Alexis was supposed to be going to Paris with her mother.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, well –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: I’ll get it!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - if you wanted to stay in a hotel I would completely understand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. No, I’m not going to leave you just because your daughter’s sick.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am going to make this up to you in so many ways.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Your ex-wife is here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meredith?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mom?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Hello Kitten.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, wha- what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Alexis, oh, my poor baby.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Aren’t you supposed to be in Paris?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Not without my daughter. And since you can’t go to Par-ee, I’m bringing Par-ee to you. French pastries and Funny Face. We can enjoy them as I nurse you back to health.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meredith, how – why – why so much luggage? Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I cannot believe that you are actually letting your ex-wife stay with you. With us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was I supposed to do, stick her in a hotel?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Look, I get her taking care of Alexis. But staying at your place?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, wait. Hang on. I turned to you, I said “is it all right with you?” and then you said yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What am I supposed to say? Everyone is looking at me. I’m not meant to be the bad guy in this case. You are. Besides, I gave you the look.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What look?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The look look. My look. Please don’t tell me after four years you don’t know the look.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’ve gotta understand –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? I’m not talking about this right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good morning, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Not from the way you sound. What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Men are clueless.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Men? Or just Castle? Well, no matter how miserable your day is, it’s not as miserable as Michelle Twohey’s. She took an icepick to the side of the neck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Michelle Twohey, the divorce lawyer for the rich and famous? Isn’t she the one who only represented women?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And strikes fear into the heart of many a soon-to-be ex-husband.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: There’s something else. When I got here she had a piece of paper clutched in her hand with a name and an address. Ryan!

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Name on the paper is R. Garrison. It’s a Scarsdale address. And it’s not in our victim’s contact numbers.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. This night clerk around the corner saw a man fleeing the scene at 11:45OM. Suspect ducked into that subway entrance over there. We’re pulling video from the security cameras and the clerk’s going to sit with a sketch artist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the victim’s family?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not anyone local. Her office gave me the boyfriend’s number. A guy named Corey Francis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. You guys see how R. Garrison figures into this. Castle and I’ll take the boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Corey, how long had you and Michelle been dating?

utterance.speaker: COREY FRANCIS
utterance.content: Less than a month. When we met, we just – it was like magic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When was the last time you spoke with her?

utterance.speaker: COREY
utterance.content: Over the weekend. She was in the middle of a divorce case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sure in her line of work she made a lot of enemies. Was there anyone in particular giving her trouble?

utterance.speaker: COREY
utterance.content: I don’t know. Her cases involved big money, big egos. But she was just doing her job. She didn’t deserve this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We had a witness that saw somebody running away from the crime scene. Do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: COREY
utterance.content: No, he doesn’t look familiar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found a Scarsdale address on her. Does the name R. Garrison sound familiar?

utterance.speaker: COREY
utterance.content: No. I never heard her mention it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Man. Look at this place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Eh, it’s all right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you kidding me?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It has always been a dream of mine to come home to a house like this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Screw the house. It’s always been a dream of mine to come home to a woman like that. Hi.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right. Until, of course, things got serious, which is when you’d dump her and start looking for your next dream woman.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD ma’am. I’m Detective Ryan, this is Detective Esposito –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just – call me Javier.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is there an R. Garrison here?

utterance.speaker: JANE GARRISON
utterance.content: Yes, that’s my husband Rob. C’mon in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hear that? Husband. And suspect.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hmm. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROB GARRISON
utterance.content: No, we’ve actually never met.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you have any idea why she’d have your name and address on her?

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Well I gave it to her last night when I spoke to her.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: I’m a forensic accountant. It’s mostly bankruptcies, but I do a lot of consulting for divorce attorneys. So Miss Twohey called me up, out of the blue, and wanted to meet and go over some financial issues.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whose financial issues? Her own?

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: She didn’t say. But I recognized her name and I knew her reputation, so I assumed it was about one of her clients. It was an odd conversation, though.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Odd? How do you mean?

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Well, she insisted on meeting today. So whatever the issues were, Miss Twohey was a bit frantic about getting them resolved quickly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, if that meeting was about a client then we’ve gotta figure out which one so head down to her office and see what cases she was working on. And you know what? Since Michelle only represented women see if any of the men she went up against threatened her. Yeah, men are known to do stupid things when it comes to their ex-wives.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. I’ll get that for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s okay, I got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, just to let you know, I’m real sorry about that whole Meredith thing. But I am going to take care of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett. Yeah okay. Lanie’s got something for us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You go deal with that. I’m going to go deal with – the other thing. Take care of it.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, you gotta take care of it. This is Meredith we’re talking about. The deep fried twinkie that Castle has ex sex with whenever she rolls back into town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie! Look, I trust him. He’s not going to have sex with her.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Fine. Let’s say it isn’t about sex. It’s about boundaries. Meredith is marking her territory. You can’t just let her waltz in and out whenever she pleases.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s in a catch-22. Alexis is sick –

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Doesn’t matter. This is a war, girl. And guess who’s losing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe you’re right.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Maybe I’m right? Of course I’m right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, I didn’t come down here to talk about this. You said you had something case related.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yes. Are you ready for some good news now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That would be nice.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I processed the victim’s clothing and found trace amounts of someone else’s blood on her jacket button.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means that our killer could have gotten cut during the attack.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m running DNA now. I’ll call you when I got something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, each one of Michelle’s employees at her law firm alibied out. But they all said she was acting odd during the past few weeks. They assumed it had to do with a case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which case?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Pick one. Introducing the wealthy men of Manhattan. Michelle represented all their wives in ongoing divorces and some of these angry husbands had threatened her. The only problem is, none of them matched our sketch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe that’s because one of them hired our mystery men to kill Michelle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But we won’t know which one until we find this guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And I just did. On the subway security video I saw our suspect swipe his MTA card. He used a credit card to buy it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Herman Poquille. A few B and E’s, aggravated assault, oh, and several attempted murders.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Congratulations. You finally succeeded.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Only thing is, we can’t figure out why you’d want to kill Miss Twohey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Purse wasn’t stolen, car wasn’t jacked. So why’d you kill her?

utterance.speaker: HERMAN POQUILLE
utterance.content: I didn’t kill her. It’s not what you think.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: C’mon, Herman. You can talk to us. Someone hired you.

utterance.speaker: POQUILLE
utterance.content: Yeah. She did. Like I said, it’s not what you think. I used to work for Michelle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Doing what?

utterance.speaker: POQUILLE
utterance.content: Photographer. Shots of husbands cheating on their wives. Stuff like that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That still doesn’t explain what you were doing at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: POQUILLE
utterance.content: Look. I botched an assignment a while ago and Michelle fired me. Then all of a sudden she’s calling me, asking me for my help on some big job.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What big job?

utterance.speaker: POQUILLE
utterance.content: She didn’t say. She said she was heading home and would wait for me near the subway. By the time I got there she was dead. I didn’t want to get mixed up in the murder, so I ran. You don’t believe me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh uh.

utterance.speaker: POQUILLE
utterance.content: Check the texts on my phone. It’s all there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So I went through Herman’s phone and he wasn’t lying. Michelle wanted to hire him to take photos and she seemed pretty desperate. Herman didn’t want to take the job and he kept texting her no, but she seemed to finally win him over with this.

utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: Okay, Herman. My texts aren’t changing your mind, so maybe this will. Look at me. I’m pleading. I have a huge problem and I need you and that camera of yours for one last job. Please. A life hangs in the balance.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A life hangs in the balance? What the hell does she need a photo of?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Hi there. Did you catch the killer already?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, no. Not yet. How’s Alexis?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Sleeping. But I’m going to wake her with some soup. Want some?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, um … no thanks. Listen, Meredith, about you staying here –

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Thanks again, Richard. I can’t tell you how much this means to me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s just, Beckett and I –

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Are wonderful. It’s so refreshing to see how secure you two are in your relationship. You know, most women would take issue with an ex-wife staying with her boyfriend. But not Kate Beckett. She gets it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, Kate gets it. Um, here’s the thing, Meredith. I –

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: I know. And … it isn’t easy for me to admit. I haven’t been the best of mothers. I missed so much of our daughter’s life. The fact that you’re letting me be here now, for Alexis during her time of need, Richard, I’ll never ever forget this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Neither will Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well what? Oh, that. Still working on that. What about – any progress on finding Michelle Twohey’s killer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Not yet. We’re still checking on the ex-husband’s alibis.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys? Uh … I think we might have our theory backwards. What if it wasn’t an angry ex-husband that killed Miss Twohey? What if it was an angry ex-wife?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, wow. Troublesome ex-wife? Imagine that? So you think one of her clients killed her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, well, Lanie got a hit on the blood on Michelle’s jacket. It belongs to a Samantha Voss. She’s in the system due to a DUI in Los Angeles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she have a grievance with Michelle?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, I’d say so. The morning of Michelle’s murder, a judge came down with a ruling on Samantha’s contentious divorce case. She lost big.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How big is big?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, Upper East Side apartment big. Cars and boats big. Half of her multi-million net worth big.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s big.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Especially when Samantha went off on a courtroom tirade accusing Michelle of screwing up her case.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA PETERMAN
utterance.content: Of course my blood was on her. Michelle completely mishandled my divorce. I was furious. Our spat became physical and I cut my hand on one of her metal jacket buttons. But I didn’t kill her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Voss –

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: Mrs. Voss is dead. I’m back to Ms. Peterman now, thank you. Oh, no, no, no, no. Don’t pack the china. That stays with my ex now. The jackhole.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Peterman, where were you last night between 10 and 1?

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: I was at a charity auction, which I chair, until 2AM.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: There are over a hundred donors that can vouch for that. Check into it if you’d like.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well you may not have killed Michelle but you certainly murdered that original Zarziny. She stabs the box with the box cutter and CASTLE grimaces.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: I don’t have to kill to get revenge when there are so many other ways to get back at my ex. Shame. That

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Peterman, if you could just refrain from destroying anything else you actually might be of some help. Now, did Michelle say or do anything out of the ordinary.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: Mmm, now let me tell you, something was sure as hell wrong in that woman’s life. Because for the for the past month she was just distracted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Distracted by what?

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: She got lost in the details of my case that had absolutely no bearing on securing a better settlement. And don’t even get me started on her personal problems.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean her personal problems?

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: Detective, I was her client, not her BFF. I don’t know. Although I can tell you, yesterday she came to court late.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: And she was crying. Oh!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she tell you why?

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: Yes. She said she was having messy personal issues.

utterance.speaker: WALTER VOSS
utterance.content: What did you do to my Zarziny?

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: Oh joy, my ex is home. Walter, Walter, Walter. Come in, we have company. Say hello.

utterance.speaker: WALTER
utterance.content: You b*itch.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: No dear. The b*itch is the skank you paid to have sex with you.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: Walter, no. No, Walter. No!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Next person to break anything goes to jail.

utterance.speaker: WALTER
utterance.content: This is all your fault.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: And it was so worth it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wow. Hell hath no fury.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did it ever get that bad with either of your exes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, both my divorces were amicable.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, a little too amicable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So something was going on with Michelle Twohey. On the morning of her death, she arrived to court late and she had been crying. So where was she coming from?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well according to her financials, she paid for breakfast at a café right before court. So maybe someone there will let us know what was so upsetting.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro. What was that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Your girlfriend just uttered a sarcastic remark about your ex-wife and all you’re going to say “what was what”?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that was nothing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Spit it out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tell us!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, okay, as you know Beckett is staying at the loft while her place is getting fumigated. Alexis is home sick as well, and then Meredith showed up and she said she wanted to stay in the loft –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And you said no.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tell me you said no.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? Letting an ex stay with you when you’re with someone else. That’s like throwing gasoline on fireworks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon, guys. It’s not that bad.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle. You are on the edge of a very, very steep cliff, my friend.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If you don’t do something about it quick …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the café owner remembers Michelle having an argument with a tall, good looking man, mid 30s, light brown hair, and blue eyes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Her boyfriend Corey Francis? I thought he hadn’t seen Michelle since the weekend. Now why would he lie?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like he’s hiding something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s bring him down here and find out what.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, and if you could have some strawberries and champagne sent up there waiting … perfect. Cedric, I owe you. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Michelle fights with her boyfriends, sets up a meeting with an accountant, and then she hires a photographer. What the hell was she in to?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. But why don’t we discuss it tonight in our oversized Jacuzzi at the Four Seasons where I just booked us the Ambassador Suite.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because your place is still being fumigated and my loft is still overrun with redheads. So I thought, why not just go an enjoy ourselves?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys? Where’s Corey Francis?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we got a problem. He’s disappeared.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His cell has been disconnected, his address is bogus, and so is his name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The guy that our victim was dating doesn’t exist?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And what’s worse, we have no way of finding him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, wait. Um … he was wearing a ring. Class ring. College ring. New York something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh yeah. It was uh … red, with a cathedral imprinted on it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … University of New York.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It might be part of his cover identity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: University of New York? C’mon. If you were going to pick a cover identity wouldn’t you pick a better school than U… … University of New York?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know we can ID him using the yearbooks. He’s in his mid-30s? So why don’t we grab everything from the University library from ’96 and on.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah well, that’s upstate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll have it for you in the morning.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No on the Four Seasons. If anyone should be sent to a hotel, it’s Meredith.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I tried. It just – it means so much to her to be there for Alexis and … it just seemed heartless to kick her out and send her to a hotel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really Castle? Because you just tried sending me to one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No! But that was because –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But nothing. Button up, Kitten. We’re going home.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh, that smells delicious. Can I have a cup?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I – was just making that for Castle, but yeah, here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how’s Alexis?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: She’s asleep. She’s always asleep. I love her, but with mono she’s a bit of a bore.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: So. You and Rick?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Me and … Rick, so … You know, you might wanna put some pants on.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Why? It’s not like I’m going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Hey, you too. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Nothing. Just making coffee. Here, this is for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, thank you. Mmm… what is in this? Did you add – nutmeg.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Nutmeg.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nutmeg?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Whenever Rick pulled all-nighters I’d sprinkle nutmeg in his coffee. Gave it an extra kick. You want to try?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. Thanks. I think I’ve had enough kick for one morning. I will be at work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Listen, um … that whole coffee thing, Meredith didn’t mean anything by that. She’s just trying to be thoughtful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sure she was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re not mad?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: About what? About how comfortable your ex-wife is in your home and with your family? How she seems to know things about you that I don’t know? Why would I be upset?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, see, this is why I wanted to stay at the Four Seasons. So you wouldn’t have to deal with this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I shouldn’t have to deal with this because you should have said no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but I didn’t. And now I can’t. I know. I’ll – I’ll send Alexis and Meredith to the Four Seasons. I’ll just hire a concierge doctor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle. I am a big girl, okay? I can be in the same place as your ex-wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’ll stay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Sure. I’ll just be subjected to her parading around half naked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. I can’t win, can I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, right. Because this is all about you now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well you made it – I – Okay, you know what? You’re right. You are absolutely right. All we have to do is get through the next few days with my crazy ex-wife. What do you say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Noah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, not no. Noah. Kesswood. Corey Francis is really –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Noah Kesswood. Former officer in the army’s military intelligence core.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Former military intelligence?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Noah uses a fake identity, starts dating Michelle and then he disappears just after she’s killed?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s the Bachelor meets Homeland.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whatever he was up to the only trace of him I could find is a loan out corporation registered in his name. There’s been a lot of recent activity. Several large wire transfers were made from a local law firm, Benedict, Cole, and Shuester.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Those payments started around the time Noah started dating Michelle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Think someone was paying Noah to spy on her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well Michelle’s cases has outcomes in the millions. Maybe an opposing lawyer was angling for an advantage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Michelle found out she was being spied on, then that lawyer would face an ethics violation and disbarment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It might have made it desperate enough to pay Noah to kill Michelle to make the problem go away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It is possible. But the best way to find out is to track down the lawyer that authorized those payments.

utterance.speaker: HOTDOG VENDOR
utterance.content: Here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mr. Schuester! Your office said we’d find you down here. I’m Detective Esposito, this is my partner Detective Ryan.

utterance.speaker: SAMUEL SCHUESTER
utterance.content: I’m guessing you’re not here for the hotdogs.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’d like you to come answer some questions about Noah Kesswood.

utterance.speaker: SCHUESTER
utterance.content: I’m sure you know I’m a criminal attorney who’s very aware of his rights. I’m not going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah. Then we can talk here.

utterance.speaker: SCHUESTER
utterance.content: You want to discuss the virtues of processed meat in tube form, fine. Otherwise you’re wasting your time.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How about we discuss the wire transfers you made to Noah Kesswood, a suspect in the murder of Michelle Twohey?

utterance.speaker: SCHUESTER
utterance.content: Save your foie gras, your roast duck, your coq au vin, for me fine dining is a New York hotdog.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Schuester, we know the last transfer was for ten grand, sent the morning Michelle was murdered.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sounds like your law firm paid Noah to kill a fellow attorney.

utterance.speaker: SCHUESTER
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe, but when we connect the dots you think the media will see it that way?

utterance.speaker: SCHUESTER
utterance.content: Okay, here’s what’s going to happen, Detectives. You’re going to find out I was instructed by a client to pay Noah Kesswood for his service. You’re going to ask what that service was. I’m going to say “I don’t know”, then you’re going to puff up and demand the name of my client, to which I’ll reply, that’s privileged information, kindly go screw yourselves. Have a hotdog, boys, they’re delicious.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Schuester may have attorney client privilege, but who he represents is a matter of public record. So, I look back into his law firm’s cases for the last five years. Turns out Schuester represented Billy Piper. You guys remember the story, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. It was all over the news for months. Famous pro golfer, getting a divorce, takes a boating trip to the Caribbean to work on his marriage –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only his wife never makes it back to shore. Billy claimed that the two of them were drinking and his wife accidently fell off of the boat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everyone assumed it was murder but the Feds never had enough to indict him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Indeed. So, what does any of this have to do with our victim? Three years ago Michelle had a client who disappeared from her boat. That client was Leann Piper.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Billy Piper’s wife? That can’t be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t think it was. In fact, I found a file on Michelle’s computer that showed she’d been looking into Leann Piper’s murder for the past month.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. What if she figured out how Billy killed his wife?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You mean, by finding actual evidence?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Then the only way Billy could stop that proof from coming out –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - was to have Michelle killed.

utterance.speaker: BILLY PIPER
utterance.content: It’s my pride and joy. Won it in Augusta in ’02.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You eagled for the win.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: That’s right. Can I get either of you two a drink?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This isn’t a social visit, Mr. Piper. We’re here to talk to you about Michelle Twohey.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Michelle Who-ey? Sorry, it doesn’t sound familiar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s odd that you don’t remember your late wife’s divorce lawyer. Did you know that she turned up dead? The reason I’m asking is because she visited you about a month ago.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Hmmm… don’t recall any visits.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You sure about that? It was right after that visit you hired Noah Kesswood.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Who’s Noah Kesswood?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The man that you paid to spy on her. And then she winds up dead. That’s awfully suspicious, don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: You people. Somebody dies, question Billy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well can you blame us? Especially after what happened with your wife?

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Okay. Let’s talk about what happened with my wife. Leann files for divorce and I fight her on it because where I’m from marriage is sacred. So Leann and I decide to go for a boat ride, like the old days. But instead of recapturing our magic Leann got drunk and fell into the ocean. So why am I the bad guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so you’re the victim here.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: You bet your ass I am. I lost my endorsements and my status. My own family wants nothing to do with me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Interesting. In the list of things you lost you didn’t include your wife.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Well. She never was my favorite trophy. Now why don’t the two of you get the hell out of my home?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well Billy did it. Killed his wife to keep his money, then had Michelle murdered when she found evidence of it. Only how do we prove it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, all roads lead to Noah. So if we can catch him we can get him to turn on Billy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perfect. Only we don’t have any way of finding him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually, we do.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Turns out the garage in Billy’s building has an automated valet system. The manager was able to pull up the records of when Noah parked there and we got his license number.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The car belongs to a fleet of vehicles that’s registered to a pharmaceutical company.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was Noah an employee there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, he has no affiliation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. You guys keep digging. There’s gotta be a connection somewhere. Hello? Yeah, Meredith. Yeah, Castle’s right here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what? You want to talk to me? Uh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Okay. Fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did she want?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She asked me to dinner tonight. Just the two of us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To – dinner. And you said yes? How could you say yes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Same way you did when she asked to stay with you. Besides Castle, if I said no that would have made me look insecure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is this as bad as it seems?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. It’s much worse. Much, much worse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Okay, hang on. It’s – take a step back from this, let’s just think about it. Just dinner.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just dinner between your ex-wife and your new girlfriend. That’s deadly. Castle. You have two worlds

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Two.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Now they’re both coming together.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh oh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What happens when worlds collide?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Boom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, guys. You are taking this a little too far.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle! Meredith knows things about you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So is there anything Meredith knows that you don’t want Beckett to know?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Boom.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Two worlds colliding.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Have I told you how lovely your penmanship is? The font is just so friendly. I just look forward to seeing it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just want to make sure you want to go to dinner with Meredith. Remember, she’s a little crazy and of course, dramatic. Ugh. Miserable combination.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you so worried about? I mean, it’s just two people who you’ve been intimate with coming together, comparing notes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Comparing notes. What notes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously, though. What notes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Espo, what do you got on Noah?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I just got off the phone with the vice president from that pharmaceutical company. Guess where he went to college? University of New York.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not only was he giving Noah access to the company car, but he’s also been letting him stay with him for the past month.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Pick him up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Boom.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There he is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, Noah Kesswood. NYPD. Come here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That hurt as much as it looked? Good.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And now you’re under arrest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look at him. Nothing like the devastated boyfriend that I met yesterday.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Noah. You’re good, man. But not that good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s not waste any time. We know that Billy hired you to spy on Michelle to see if she had any proof that he killed his wife.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And when you discovered she did, on Billy’s orders you put an icepick through her neck.

utterance.speaker: NOAH KESSWOOD
utterance.content: I didn’t kill Michelle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t believe you.

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: You don’t have to. See when Michelle was being shish kebob’ed I was all the way up at the University of New York watching my alma mater play West Virginia. We won, by the way. Go Broncos.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you didn’t kill her then why’d you work so hard to disappear?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: Detective, what do you say you buy me a soda, hum?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: Not you. You.

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: All right, look. I deal in intelligence. Not murder. Never murder. You want the truth? Okay, here it is, free of charge. Billy Piper’s absolutely paranoid. So when Michelle came around asking questions about that night on the boat he went into full on panic mode. Figured she probably had a vendetta against him. Wanted him in jail for murdering her client. Reality is, he was probably right. She said she was close. Very close to finding out what happened on that boat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are we talking actual evidence?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: Maybe. She was gathering the final puzzle pieces at the New York office of the DEA.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Drug Enforcement Agency? Why?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: You’d have to ask them, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, I’m still gonna have to hold you, you know.

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: For up to 24 hours. And then you’ll never see me again.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, thanks Bill. Well, Noah’s alibi is solid. He’s definitely not the killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But do we believe his story about the DEA? I mean, what does any of this have to do with drugs?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, there’s only one way to find out. Ryan, see if you can uncover was Michelle was doing at the DEA.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll try, but it’s late. Probably won’t hear anything until the morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I guess we should call it a night. Okay, Castle. See you later.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Later? We can go back to my place together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, I have a dinner date with your ex-wife, remember?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I remember. I was just hoping you’d forget.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, don’t wait up.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh darling, please. Just relax.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t relax, Mother. My worlds are colliding, okay? My – I can’t relax.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, have a glass of wine. Works for me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bet they’re out there right now, telling secrets about me. Boom What do I do? Should I call them? I should call them.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No. No. No. What you shouldn’t have done was let Meredith stay here in the first place. This isn’t a flop house, darling. You’ve gotta stop letting freeloaders just live here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please tell me you see the irony.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Meredith. Castle did that? I can’t believe that you married … him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What can’t you believe? What – no. What? No. C’mon, Beckett. There’s two sides to that story that – what did you – what story – what did you tell her?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: The truth, Richard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you’re not the man that I thought I knew.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m the man that you thought you knew. I’m the man you know. I thought you – I’m that – you think – I know you. I’m him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is so not cool.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, you’re right. He does lean to the left.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Told you. Only when he’s stressed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I never even noticed that before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What – what leans?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Meredith. That was so fun.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Thanks for coming.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You have a great night. Night Martha.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Night, darling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, what did she say about me? Ugh, c’mon. I get it. I get it. I mishandled this whole thing. But believe me, I am sorry. Please? Tell me what Meredith said. Is it anything I need to be worried about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what, Castle? As much fun as it would be to continue torturing you, I actually like you a little bit more now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm, yeah. Meredith is a fun, dynamic, and hard to say no to woman. But, as long as we’re together, she never stays here again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That goes without saying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let it go to voicemail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, it’s the precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, I just got off with the DEA. You need to get down here right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, okay. We’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Michelle was very interested in the DEA’s Caribbean drug interdiction efforts, which involve the tracking of planes and boats using satellite photos. She obtained this three year old satellite photo from the night of Leann Piper’s murder. Take a look.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s two boats.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Less than 50 feet apart. And they identified that one as Billy Piper’s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s how he got away with it. That’s why Leann was never found. Billy was afraid her body would wash up so he enlisted an accomplice to take the remains and dump them where nobody would ever look.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Michelle got on to this, that accomplice might be the person who murdered her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but how did she know to look for another boat?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It was recently listed as an asset in one of her divorce cases. And guys, you’re never going to guess who the accomplice is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello, Walter.

utterance.speaker: WALTER
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re here to see a man about a boat.

utterance.speaker: WALTER
utterance.content: Why would I kill my ex-wife’s divorce lawyer? She did a terrible job, and because of that I won.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you want to know why you won? Because Michelle was spending all of her time sifting through your financials from three years ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She became very interested in how your family and Billy Piper’s family were all members of the same yacht club.

utterance.speaker: WALTER
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You and Billy Piper were friends.

utterance.speaker: WALTER
utterance.content: Again, I respond, so?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Michelle found proof that you refueled your boat near the waters where Billy’s wife was killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She tracked your boat using satellite photos. This is Billy Piper’s boat, where his wife was last seen. And who is this over here? Oh, it’s yours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The DEA identified it as your boat. You were Billy’s accomplice.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The two of you had a pretty good plan. Except that there was one thing that you couldn’t foresee.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That your wife would hire Michelle to represent her in your divorce.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Michelle was probably looking for proof of an affair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except she found something much worse. That little boat trip you took to the Caribbean? As she looked closer to who you were with and why you were there, she discovered the truth.

utterance.speaker: WALTER
utterance.content: I want to talk to my lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Without a confession our case is purely speculative.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We could dig into Walter’s life. Maybe find some proof?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And some motive too, if we’re lucky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so it’s not just me. Walter has no real motive, does he?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I mean, why would Walter help Billy kill his wife? Yeah, sure, they’re friends, but what was in it for Walter?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not like they agreed to kill each other’s wives like Strangers on a Train. Though what we saw of Walter’s relationship, I’m sure he thought about it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey guys. I found something in Walter’s phone records and I’m not quite sure what to make of it. On the morning of Michelle’s murder Walter made a 20 minute phone call to the Garrison residence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Garrison? The accountant that Michelle was so desperate to meet? Why would Walter call him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s this?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The woman of my dreams. She’s married to that accountant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, look at Billy’s dead wife. And now look at the accountant’s wife. Different hair, different nose, different chin, but –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re the same woman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s why they never found a body. Because Billy’s dead wife Leann … is alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Again, thank you, Mrs. Garrison, for coming down here at such a late hour.

utterance.speaker: JANE GARRISON
utterance.content: Didn’t my husband answer all the other detective’s questions?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, he did. But there was just one that only you can answer. Who’s this woman?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here. Let me get that for you.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Sorry, I don’t recognize her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You sure about that? ‘cause, you know, you can change your name, you can change your looks. But there is one thing that you cannot change. Your fingerprints. We know who you are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello Leann. Welcome back from the dead.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I think you must have the wrong person.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can drop the charade, Leann. We spoke with your current husband. He said you drove into the city the night Michelle was killed. And he also identified the murder weapon as a mahogany handled icepick missing from your kitchen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, it’s funny. For a minute there we thought Walter was helping Billy. But actually, he was helping you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The only thing that we couldn’t figure out was why? Why did you go through all of this?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Because everybody loved Billy. You try being married to him. He was a hero in public and a monster at home. When I finally got the courage to divorce him do you know how the media portrayed me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As another gold digging trophy wife looking for her half.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: He destroyed my reputation. He was going to destroy me. The only way that I could get my life back was to die.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you needed help.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: And Walter needed the money. At least he did at the time. So we devised a plan. I convinced Billy to take the trip. And then when the scotch put him to sleep –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You escaped onto Walter’s boat, turning your husband into a wife killer.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: It’s what he deserved. And I got to start over. I was supposed to leave the country, but I met Rob and I fell for him. We were so happy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Until Michelle put the pieces together.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: She said she couldn’t live with the injustice. I mean, can you believe that? From a lawyer? She sided with Billy. I mean, she knew what he was like. She knew what he did to me. Why couldn’t she just leave it alone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stand up. Let’s go. C’mon. Stand up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Turn around, hands behind your back. Leann Piper, you are under arrest for the murder of Michelle Twohey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I mean, I know your apartment is habitable again. I just – do you have to leave?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you want me here because you actually want me here or do you need protection from the redheads?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A little of both.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll tell you what. If it gets to be too much, you can come and stay at my place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Are you sure it’s okay that I’m going to Par-ee without you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Just because I’m sick, you shouldn’t miss it. I want you to go.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: We all do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I just feel so guilty that Mom is missing her vacation because I’m sick, so I told her to enjoy Paris for the both of us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure, Alexis? I mean, your mother – – should … enjoy her vacation. Have a safe trip, Meredith.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Je t'aime maman.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Moi aussi, je t'aime.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Adios, dear. Have fun.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Martha. Well, this has been … oh shoot. I left my purse upstairs. Be a dear –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll grab it.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, it was a real pleasure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, it really was. You know, Meredith, it’s so funny, when you first came and insisted on staying here I was afraid that you might have had a secret agenda.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Actually, I did. When Alexis told me about you two and how this one was serious, I knew I had to check it out for myself. And I’m so glad I did. You two are great together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. Can I ask you a question? Why didn’t it work out? Between you and Rick?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, is that too personal?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh no, no, no. It’s fine. You know, being married to Richard was great. Full of romance and excitement. Like a deliciously sweet soufflé. And then one day I realized he knew everything about me. My deepest secrets, my worse pain. Enough to fill a million novels. But I didn’t know enough about him to even write a pamphlet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: For instance, whenever I asked him how he felt about never knowing his father, he would smirk. You know the way he smirks. And then he would throw out a quip and change the subject. Our marriage went one way. It wasn’t enough for me. I mean, soufflé’s are wonderful. But sooner or later, they always fall.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh, but that was a long, long time ago. What, 15 years in fact. He’s a totally different man now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Of course. I was just curious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, here we go.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh, you are the best, Rick. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh, I hope we see each other again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Me too. Have a wonderful trip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How about I make you a little breakfast before you leave?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to whip you up a smore’lette. It sounds better than it tastes, but that’s – it’s – you’ll love it.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
